solution_line_template: The first movie was {hour_in_minutes} + {first_movie_extra_minutes} = <<{hour_in_minutes}+{first_movie_extra_minutes}={first_movie_minutes}>>{first_movie_minutes} minutes long since an hour has 60 minutes.
The second movie was {first_movie_minutes} + {second_movie_extra_minutes} = <<{first_movie_minutes}+{second_movie_extra_minutes}={second_movie_minutes}>>{second_movie_minutes} minutes long.
It took them a total of {first_movie_minutes} + {second_movie_minutes} = <<{first_movie_minutes}+{second_movie_minutes}={total_movie_minutes}>>{total_movie_minutes} minutes to watch the two movies.
It took them {popcorn_minutes} x {fries_multiplier} = <<{popcorn_minutes}*{fries_multiplier}={fries_minutes}>>{fries_minutes} minutes to cook the fries.
Thus, it took them a total of {popcorn_minutes} + {fries_minutes} = <<{popcorn_minutes}+{fries_minutes}={total_cooking_minutes}>>{total_cooking_minutes} minutes to cook.
So, they spent {total_movie_minutes} + {total_cooking_minutes} = <<{total_movie_minutes}+{total_cooking_minutes}={total_minutes}>>{total_minutes} minutes watching the movies and cooking.
In hours, this is equal to {total_minutes}/{minutes_per_hour} = <<{total_minutes}/{minutes_per_hour}={total_hours}>>{total_hours} hours.
